page.title: 15RATHEUGH FOLLY
page.content: On {Ratheugh Crag}stands the{Folly} which the {1st Duke of Northumberland} had built as an {observatory.}It was designed by {Robert Adam}and probably built by {John Bell}who built{ {Pottergate Tower}and{St.Michael's Pant in{Alnwick}at about the same time.The obsevatory was built so that the Duke could take guests out riding to view his lands which had been newly landscaped as far as{Brizlee Tower}by{ {Capability Brown.}The Folly was built to look like a ruined castle and the Duke's room at the top is reached by a narrow spiral staircase.Nowadays it is only used about twice a year for the {Point to Point Meeting.}Rooks or crows build huge nests on the staircase.For about 5years Taffy Carter lived there but as there was only a well for water and no electricity ,he had to leave when his wife became ill.
